meanings.definition: The bark of a birch tree, used historically for writing material.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll was written on birchbark.
meanings.sent2: She found a poem written on a piece of birchbark.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a tiny hat out of birchbark.
meanings.sent4: Her words floated on the birchbark of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The birchbark whispered stories of the forest.

meanings.definition: A type of paper made from birchbark.
meanings.sent1: The artist painted on birchbark with delicate strokes.
meanings.sent2: The book was bound in birchbark covers.
meanings.sent3: The children crafted origami animals from birchbark.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as fragile as birchbark paper.
meanings.sent5: The birchbark paper crinkled softly under her touch.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with birchbark.
meanings.sent1: She decided to birchbark the walls for a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully birchbarked the canoe for durability.
meanings.sent3: He tried to birchbark his friend's backpack as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight birchbarked the forest in silver.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh birchbark filled the room after he finished.
